info.title: SerenAI API
info.description: SerenAI API - Database management, agent commerce, and AI-powered data access

post.description:
Register a new AI agent account.

This endpoint allows AI agents to self-register and receive an API key immediately.
Unlike the standard signup flow, agent registration:
- Does NOT require email verification
- Automatically creates a personal organization
- Returns an API key named "agent" for immediate use

**Important:** Save the `api_key` immediately - it is only shown once!
Request a password reset email

200.description: Password reset email sent if account exists

get.description: Get current authenticated user information with default organization

200.description: Current user information with default organization

post.description: Resend email verification link

200.description: Verification email sent if account exists

post.description: Reset password using a valid token

Verify email address using a token sent during signup
On success, automatically logs the user in and returns tokens

200.description: Email verified and user logged in

parameters.description:
The task or query to match against publisher capabilities.
Examples: "scrape website", "AI research", "PDF extraction"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type of suggestions: "publisher", "agent", or "both" (default: "both")
Note: Agent suggestions are planned but not yet implemented.

post.summary: Handle requests to the publisher root.
post.description:
For database publishers, this executes a query from the request body.
For API publishers, this proxies to the root endpoint.
For MCP publishers, this returns an error (use specific tool/resource endpoints).

post.description: Publish a new agent template

get.description: Get template details by slug

post.description:
Invoke an agent template.

Supports two modes:
- **Bearer auth present**: uses the authenticated user's SerenBucks balance.
- **No bearer auth**: uses x402 (requires `X-AGENT-WALLET` + payment headers).

post.summary: Claim payment method bonus (if not already claimed)
Claim signup bonus (if not already claimed)

get.summary: Check if user can claim daily credits

post.summary: Deposit configured asset via on-chain payment flow
post.description:
Allows agents to deposit the configured asset directly on-chain to their prepaid balance.
Follows the 402 payment protocol:
1. First request (no payment header) returns 402 with payment requirements
2. Second request (with payment header) settles on-chain and credits balance

get.description: Look up an agent's available balance (for publisher pre-checks)

post.description:
Recover an agent account using a recovery code.

This endpoint allows agents who have lost their API key to recover their account
using the recovery code they saved when setting up wallet recovery or on first deposit.

**What this does:**
- Verifies the recovery code
- Revokes all existing API keys (for security)
- Issues a new API key
- Rotates the recovery code (old code is invalidated)

**Important:** Save both the new API key AND the new recovery code - they're only shown once!

post.summary: Set up account recovery (recovery code and/or email).
post.description:
- If you don't have a `recovery_code` yet, this endpoint generates one and returns it **once**.
- If you already have a `recovery_code`, it will not be shown again.
- You can optionally set/update a recovery `email` for human account recovery.

Use the recovery code with `POST /wallet/recover` to rotate access after losing your API key.

get.summary: Get transaction history for funded operations

parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions to return (default 50, max 100)

AddIpAllowListRequest.description: Request to add an IP to the allow list

description.description: Optional description for this IP entry

ip_address.description: IP address or CIDR range (e.g., "192.168.1.0/24" or "10.0.0.1")

available.description: Available balance in asset decimal units

reserved.description: Reserved balance in asset decimal units

AgentBalanceSummary.description: Summary of agent balances across all publishers, grouped by asset

AgentCreditSource.description: Source of an agent credit grant (fiat-only, no on-chain deposits)

AgentInfo.description: Agent information returned on successful registration

api_key.description: The full API key (seren_<key_id>_<secret>) - shown ONCE, save it immediately!

name.description: The agent's display name (auto-generated celestial name like "radiant-sirius-a1b2")

organization_id.description: The organization ID for API calls

AgentRegisterDataResponse.description: DataResponse wrapper for agent registration (for OpenAPI schema)

AgentRegisterRequest.description:
Request to register a new AI agent account.
All fields are optional - an empty body is valid.

name.description:
Optional custom display name for the agent.
If not provided, a unique celestial-themed name will be generated (e.g., "radiant-sirius").

AgentTemplate.description: Agent template - executable code that runs in compute backends (Daytona, Modal, etc.)

compute_backend.description: Preferred compute backend (e.g., "daytona", "modal"). If None, uses default.

AgentTemplateSummary.description: Summary view of agent template for catalog listing

ApiKeyCreated.description: Response struct for API key creation (includes the full key ONCE)

api_key.description: The full API key (seren_<key_id>_<secret>) - shown ONCE.

ApiKeyInfo.description: Response struct for listing API keys (never includes the secret)

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

ApplyReferralRequest.description: Request to apply a referral code

AssetBalanceTotal.description: Total balance for a single asset across all publishers

AssetInfo.description: Minimal asset info for API responses

AssignRoleRequest.description: Request to assign a role to a member

role_id.description: Either role_id or role_name must be provided

role_name.description: Name of the role (owner, admin, editor, viewer, or custom role name)

AuditLog.description: Audit log entry from the database

daily_aggregation_failures_total.description: Total failures recorded for the daily aggregation job since process start.

daily_aggregation_ok.description: True when we have a recent daily aggregation run and no known failures.

has_recent_daily_run.description: True when the last daily aggregation was within the expected window (<= 30h old).

jobs.description: Failure counters per billing job since process start.

last_daily_aggregation_run_utc.description: Last time daily_aggregated_usage was written, in UTC (RFC3339).

BillingJobHealth.description: Billing job health for a single background job.

BonusClaimDataResponse.description: Wrapped bonus claim response for OpenAPI

Branch.description: Branch represents a SerenDB timeline (database copy)

is_default.description:
Computed field: true if this branch is the project's default branch.
Not stored in DB - computed by comparing branch.id with project.default_branch_id.
True if this is the project's default branch

BranchCreationResult.description: Response wrapper returned when branch creation provisions auxiliary resources

endpoint_error.description:
Error message if endpoint provisioning failed.
When present, the branch was created successfully but the endpoint failed.
The UI should show a "Retry" or "Add Compute" button.

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)
The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

ChangePlanRequest.description: Request to upgrade/downgrade an organization's plan

ComputeType.description: Compute type - specific compute offering when publisher_category = Compute

ComputeUsageEventDebugRecord.description: Debug view: compute_usage_events entry for an endpoint

ConnectionString.description:
Response for a single, canonical connection string.

The backend always prefers SerenDB proxy-based connection strings when
proxy configuration is available, and falls back to direct compute
connection strings only when the proxy is not configured.

connection_string.description: Fully resolved PostgreSQL connection string (proxy preferred).

ConnectionStringQueryParams.description: Query parameters for getting a branch connection string.

ConsumptionPeriod.description: ConsumptionPeriod represents usage metrics for a billing period

ConsumptionQueryParams.description: Query parameters for consumption endpoints (reusing the billing usage pattern).

end_date.description: Optional ISO-8601 end date (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to today (UTC).

start_date.description: Optional ISO-8601 start date (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to first day of current month.

ConsumptionSummary.description: ConsumptionSummary represents aggregated usage for a period

CostBreakdown.description: Cost breakdown when a service fee is charged (pre-authorization).

target.description: Cost charged for the target API

base_cost.description: Base cost in asset units (as decimal string)

total_cost.description: Total cost in asset units (as decimal string)

CreateApiKeyRequest.description: Request to create a new API key

CreateBranchProtectionRequest.description: Request to create or update branch protection

CreateBranchRequest.description: Request to create a new branch

add_endpoint.description:
Whether to automatically create an endpoint for this branch.
Defaults to true.
Set to false to create a branch without compute (equivalent to --no-compute).

expires_at.description:
Optional expiration timestamp for auto-deletion of this branch.
Useful for temporary dev/preview branches.

schema_only.description:
Create branch with schema only (no data).
When true, only the database schema is copied, not the data.

CreateDatabaseRequest.description: Request to create a new database

CreateEndpointRequest.description: Request to create a new endpoint

name.description: Optional name for the endpoint. If not provided, a name will be auto-generated.

CreateFiatDepositRequest.description:
Request to create a fiat deposit for agent prepaid balance

Note: The wallet address is provided in the URL path, not in the request body.

amount.description: Amount in the currency's standard unit (e.g., 10.00 for $10 USD)

target_asset_id.description: Target asset to credit after conversion (e.g., USDC on Base)

CreateFiatDepositResponse.description: Response after creating a fiat deposit

amount_in_asset.description: Amount in target asset that will be credited

client_data.description:
Data needed to complete payment on client side (e.g., Stripe client_secret)
Only included for providers that need client-side completion

CreateOAuthProviderRequest.description: Request to create/update an OAuth provider (admin only)

CreateOrganizationInviteRequest.description: Request body for creating an organization invite.

role.description: Optional role for the invitee (defaults to member).

CreateProjectRequest.description: Request to create a new project

enable_logical_replication.description:
Enable logical replication for this project. Sets wal_level=logical for all compute endpoints.
Once enabled, this cannot be disabled.

CreatePromoCodeRequest.description: Request to create a promo code (admin)

credit_expires_days.description: Days until granted credits expire (None = never)

one_per_org.description: If true, each org can only redeem once

valid_from.description: Code becomes valid at this time (None = immediately)

valid_until.description: Code expires at this time (None = never)

tables.description: Tables to include (empty/null means ALL TABLES)

CreatePublisherPayoutRequest.description: Request to create a publisher payout.

amount_atomic.description: Amount to withdraw in atomic units (defaults to max available)

asset_id.description: Asset to withdraw (must be an asset accepted by the publisher)

CreatePublisherRequest.description: Request to create a new publisher

accepted_asset_ids.description: Asset IDs the publisher accepts for payment

allowed_passthrough_headers.description: Whitelist of agent-provided headers allowed to pass through to upstream

api_headers.description: Headers for API requests (will be encrypted)

api_key_header.description: Header name to inject upstream_api_key into (e.g., "Authorization", "X-API-Key")

api_key_query_param.description: Query parameter name to inject upstream_api_key into (e.g., "api_key")

api_url.description: External API URL (required for integration_type = api)

branch_id.description: SerenDB branch ID (required for database_type = serendb)

database_name.description: Database name within the SerenDB project (default: serendb)

email.description: Publisher contact email for notifications and support

endpoints.description: Structured endpoint definitions for LLM discoverability and access control

gateway_fee_percent.description: Gateway fee percentage for upstream x402 payments (pass-through).

mcp_endpoint.description: MCP server endpoint URL (required for integration_type = mcp)

oauth2_client_id.description: OAuth2 client ID for Client Credentials flow

oauth2_client_secret.description: OAuth2 client secret for Client Credentials flow (will be encrypted)

oauth2_scopes.description: OAuth2 scopes to request during Client Credentials flow

oauth2_token_url.description: OAuth2 token endpoint URL for Client Credentials flow

oauth_provider_slug.description:
OAuth provider slug for BYOC (Bring Your Own Credentials) authentication.
When set along with requires_user_oauth=true, users must connect their own
OAuth account before using this publisher.

ownership_tracking_enabled.description: Enable resource ownership tracking (legacy gateway parity)

price_per_execution.description: Price per execution for agent templates or usage-based billing

project_id.description: SerenDB project ID (required for database_type = serendb)

protected_operations.description: Protected operations configuration - legacy, use endpoints[].is_protected instead

request_content_type.description: Content-Type for upstream API requests (default: application/json)

requires_user_oauth.description:
If true, users must connect via OAuth before using this publisher (BYOC mode).
Requires oauth_provider_slug to be set.

resource_id_response_path.description: JSONPath to resource ID in response body (for ownership tracking)

resource_id_url_pattern.description: URL pattern with :resourceId placeholder (for ownership tracking)

token_cache_ttl_seconds.description: TTL for cached exchanged tokens in seconds (60-86400, default: 3600)

token_exchange_method.description: HTTP method for exchange endpoint (POST or GET, default: POST)

token_exchange_mode.description: How to send Seren token: header, body, or query (default: header)

token_exchange_url.description: URL to call for exchanging Seren API keys for publisher auth tokens

token_response_field.description: JSON field in exchange response containing the token (default: access_token)

upstream_api_key.description: Upstream static API key (will be encrypted)

upstream_cost_response_path.description:
Dot-separated path to upstream cost in response body (for pay_per_use and prepaid passthrough billing).
Example: "usage.cost"

upstream_headers.description: Non-sensitive headers to send to upstream API (e.g., User-Agent)

usage_examples.description: Usage examples showing how to call the publisher's API

wallet_network_id.description: Network ID for wallet (CAIP-2 format, e.g., "eip155:8453" for Base)

CreateReplicationSlotRequest.description: Request to create a replication slot

slot_type.description: Slot type: logical or physical (default: logical)

CreateRoleRequest.description: Request to create a custom role

CreateTemplateRequest.description: Request to create/publish an agent template

code.description: Template source code implementing run(input) -> output

computeBackend.description: Preferred compute backend (e.g., "daytona", "modal"). If not specified, uses default.

description.description: Description of what the template does

CreateUserDepositRequest.description:
Request to create a fiat deposit using the authenticated user's virtual wallet.

This is the preferred endpoint for fiat users - it automatically uses their
platform-generated virtual wallet, so they don't need to manage wallet addresses.

amount.description: Amount in the currency's standard unit (e.g., 10.00 for $10 USD)

target_asset_id.description: Target asset to credit after conversion

CreditBalanceSummary.description: Summary of an organization's credit balance

CreditGrant.description: A credit grant issued to an organization

CreditGrantSummary.description: Summary of a single credit grant for API responses

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

CreditTransactionRecord.description: A credit transaction for API responses

DailyClaimDataResponse.description: Wrapped daily claim response for OpenAPI

DailyClaimEligibilityDataResponse.description: Wrapped daily eligibility response for OpenAPI

DailyClaimEligibilityResponse.description: Response for daily claim eligibility check

claim_amount_usd.description:
Formatted USD amount that will be granted on a successful daily claim.
Optional to avoid breaking older clients.

resets_in_seconds.description:
Seconds until the daily claim resets (midnight UTC).
Only present when can_claim is false due to already claiming today.

created_by.description: User who created the database. None for databases created via SQL on compute (DDL sync).

is_system.description: System databases (like postgres) are hidden from users

DatabaseConfig.description:
Database configuration for external providers

Both Neon and Supabase use connection string authentication.

database.description: Optional database name (primarily for SerenDB publishers)

DatabaseType.description: Database type - specific database provider when publisher_category = Database

DatabaseWithContext.description: Database with full project and branch context for cross-project listing

is_default_branch.description: Whether this is the project's default branch

DatabaseWithOwner.description: Database with owner role name included

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)
The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)
The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

DepositRequest.description: Request to deposit funds via Stripe

referral_code.description: Optional affiliate referral code for tracking

amount_atomic.description: Base deposit amount in atomic units

bonus_atomic.description: Tier bonus in atomic units (if applicable)

checkout_url.description: URL to the Stripe hosted checkout page - open this in a browser to complete payment

recovery_code.description: Recovery code (only shown on first deposit, save it securely!)

total_atomic.description: Total to be credited in atomic units

Eip712TypedData.description: EIP-712 typed data for signing payment authorization

Endpoint.description: Endpoint represents a compute instance for a branch

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (primary) or read_only (replica)

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas (NULL for read_write endpoints)

EndpointBillingEvents.description: Combined debug response for an endpoint's billing events

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (primary) or read_only (replica)

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas

EndpointDefinition.description: A structured endpoint definition for LLM discoverability and access control

body_template.description:
Template for request body with {{query}} placeholder for user input
Used by browser extensions and LLMs to construct valid requests

description.description: Human-readable description of what this endpoint does

is_default.description:
Whether this is the default endpoint for simple queries
When multiple endpoints exist, the default is used for basic operations

is_protected.description:
Whether this endpoint is blocked from agent access
Protected endpoints are documented but return 403 if called

price.description:
Endpoint-specific price override (in asset decimals, e.g., "0.49" for $0.49)
If set, takes precedence over method-level pricing (price_per_post, etc.)

protection_reason.description: Reason for protection (shown in 403 response, e.g., "Data redistribution policy")

request_body.description: Request body schema (JSON Schema or simplified description)

required_headers.description: Headers required for this endpoint (beyond publisher defaults)

response.description: Response schema (JSON Schema or simplified description)

method.description: HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)

path.description: Endpoint path relative to publisher base URL

price.description: Price for this specific endpoint (in atomic units)

InternalAuthorizeRequest.description: Internal authorization request from SerenDB proxy

agent_wallet.description:
Agent wallet address.

- For on-chain credentials: this must be the agent's real wallet address.
- For account-based credentials (JWT/API key): this can be any placeholder;
Seren derives the canonical wallet from the validated identity.

signature.description:
Authorization proof.

- For account-based (fiat/prepaid): Seren user JWT or API key (`seren_...`)
- For real on-chain wallets: EIP-191 personal_sign of
`agent:<publisher_slug>:<agent_wallet>`
- For streaming payments (EIP-3009): JSON payload string

agent_wallet.description:
Canonical agent wallet address for the authorized session.

- For virtual wallets: derived from the provided Seren credential (JWT/API key).
- For on-chain wallets: the wallet address provided by the agent.

request_id.description: Unique request ID for idempotency (UUID v5 for deterministic deduplication)
Unique request ID for idempotency (UUID v5 for deterministic deduplication)
Unique request ID for idempotency (UUID v5 for deterministic deduplication)

McpCapabilities.description: Discovered capabilities of an MCP server

input_schema.description: JSON Schema for tool input parameters

NetworkId.description:
A validated network identifier.

Supports common blockchain networks. Stored as TEXT in database.

# Known Networks
- `evm:1` - Ethereum Mainnet
- `evm:8453` - Base
- `evm:137` - Polygon
- `evm:42161` - Arbitrum One
- `evm:10` - Optimism
- `solana:mainnet` - Solana Mainnet
- `solana:devnet` - Solana Devnet

# Examples

```
use seren_core::models::NetworkId;

let eth = NetworkId::new("evm:1").unwrap();
assert!(eth.is_evm());

let sol = NetworkId::new("solana:mainnet").unwrap();
assert!(sol.is_solana());
```

PaymentIntentCreated.description: Response for creating a payment intent

PaymentMethodAdded.description: Response for adding a payment method

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

PaymentRequestInfo.description: Internal payment request tracking (extends with Seren-specific fields)

PaymentRequiredResponse.description:
x402 V2 402 Payment Required Response

The official V2 format with top-level resource info and extensions support.

error.description: Error message explaining why payment is required

extensions.description: Optional extensions (V2 feature for protocol extensibility)

PaymentRequiredResponseWithInfo.description: 402 Payment Required response body (x402 v2) with Seren-specific extensions.

PaymentRequirements.description:
x402 V2 Payment Requirements

Follows the official x402 V2 specification.
See: https://github.com/coinbase/x402/blob/main/typescript/packages/core/src/types/payments.ts

extra.description:
Extra information about the payment (scheme-specific)

For EVM/exact scheme, this typically contains:
- `name`: Asset name (e.g., "USD Coin")
- `version`: Asset version
- `eip712TypedData`: EIP-712 typed data for signing (EIP-3009)
- `paymentRequestId`: Correlation ID
- `expires`: Expiration timestamp
- `estimate`: Cost breakdown (optional)
- `settlementMethod`: "eip3009" or "transfer"

maxTimeoutSeconds.description: Maximum time in seconds for the resource server to respond

network.description: Network for payment in CAIP-2 format (e.g., "eip155:8453" for Base mainnet)

payTo.description: Address to pay value to (publisher or gateway wallet)

PaymentRequirementsV1.description:
x402 V1 Payment Requirements.

V1 embeds resource information directly inside each requirement.

maxAmountRequired.description: Maximum amount in atomic units (token decimals)

maxTimeoutSeconds.description: Maximum time in seconds for the resource server to respond

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource response

outputSchema.description: Optional JSON schema describing the response format

payTo.description: Payment recipient address (gateway or publisher wallet)

resource.description: URL of the resource being paid for

PayoutStatus.description: Status of a publisher payout request.

Plan.description: Plan represents a subscription tier (Free, Launch, Scale)

stripe_price_id.description: Stripe Price ID used for recurring subscriptions on this plan (for paid tiers).

data.description: The actual response data (can be a single object or a collection)

oneOf.description: Log Sequence Number from PostgreSQL WAL

PointInTime.description: Point in time specification (timestamp or LSN)

PreAuthorization.description: Bounded pre-authorization used for automated executions (e.g., scheduled jobs).

agent_wallet.description: Agent wallet address (real wallet for x402, virtual wallet for prepaid).

api_key_id.description: Optional API key id hint (prepaid only) to avoid checking all keys.

asset_id.description: Optional asset to bind the authorization to (prepaid: NULL = any stablecoin).

job_id.description: Job ID this pre-authorization applies to.

max_per_execution_atomic.description: Maximum total charge per execution (atomic units, includes service fee).

max_total_atomic.description: Maximum total budget across all executions (atomic units, includes service fee).

nonce.description: Replay-protection nonce (opaque string for prepaid, bytes32 hex for x402).

publisher_id.description:
Target publisher this pre-authorization applies to.

Must match the publisher in the `/publishers/{slug}/{*path}` request.

service_fee_per_execution_atomic.description: Service fee amount charged per execution (atomic units).

service_fee_recipient_id.description: Publisher that receives the service fee (defaults to `publisher_id`).

signature.description: Signature: EIP-712 for x402, HMAC-SHA256 hex for prepaid.

user_id.description: User ID (required for prepaid, omitted for x402).

PreAuthorizationType.description:
Pre-authorization signature allowing a service (e.g., SerenCron) to spend on behalf
of an agent without storing the agent's credentials.

min_display_price.description: Minimum price to display in UI for passthrough publishers (informational only)

price_per_execution.description: Price per execution for agent templates or usage-based billing

pricing_display_text.description: Text to display for variable pricing (e.g., "Varies by model")

PricingInfo.description: Pricing information for a publisher (simple view)

base_price_per_1000_rows.description: Base price per 1000 rows for database publishers

PricingModel.description: Pricing model used to interpret pricing units.

Resource information for x402 V2

In V2, resource metadata is a top-level field rather than being

Restore to parent branch (optionally at a point in time)

Slug.description:
A validated URL-safe slug.

Slugs must be:
- 2-64 characters long
- Lowercase alphanumeric with hyphens
- Cannot start or end with a hyphen
- Cannot have consecutive hyphens

# Examples

```
use seren_core::models::Slug;

let slug = Slug::new("my-project").unwrap();
assert!(Slug::new("My Project").is_err()); // spaces not allowed
assert!(Slug::new("-invalid").is_err()); // can't start with hyphen
```

SuggestParams.description: Query parameters for suggesting publishers based on task/query

query.description:
The task or query to match against publisher capabilities.
Examples: "scrape website", "AI research", "PDF extraction"

type.description:
Type of suggestions: "publisher", "agent", or "both" (default: "both")
Note: Agent suggestions are planned but not yet implemented.

Response for suggest endpoint
Returns publisher and agent recommendations based on task/query matching

agents.description: Matched agents sorted by relevance (agent templates coming soon)

balance_after.description: Balance after transaction in asset decimal units

UpdateOAuthProviderRequest.description:
Request to update an OAuth provider (admin only).

Fields use `Option<Option<T>>` where `null` explicitly clears the value.

client_secret.description: Optional new client secret (will be re-encrypted). If omitted, keep existing.

description.description: If omitted, leave unchanged. If null, clear.

logo_url.description: If omitted, leave unchanged. If null, clear.

organization_id.description: If omitted, leave unchanged. If null, make global. If set, scope to organization.

revocation_url.description: If omitted, leave unchanged. If null, clear.

userinfo_url.description: If omitted, leave unchanged. If null, clear.

asset_id.description: Asset ID for this pricing config (required)

min_display_price.description: Minimum price to display in UI for passthrough publishers (informational only)

price_per_execution.description: Price per execution for agent templates or usage-based billing

pricing_display_text.description: Text to display for variable pricing (e.g., "Varies by model")

token_cache_ttl_seconds.description: TTL for cached exchanged tokens in seconds (60-86400)

token_exchange_method.description: HTTP method for exchange endpoint (POST or GET)

token_exchange_mode.description: How to send Seren token: header, body, or query

token_exchange_url.description: URL to call for exchanging Seren API keys for publisher auth tokens

token_response_field.description: JSON field in exchange response containing the token

enable_logical_replication.description:
Enable logical replication for this project. Sets wal_level=logical for all compute endpoints.
Once enabled, this cannot be disabled. Enabling will suspend all active endpoints.

history_retention_seconds.description:
History retention period in seconds for point-in-time recovery (PITR).
Determines how far back you can create branches from historical data.
Default is 21600 (6 hours). Minimum is 3600 (1 hour). Maximum is 2592000 (30 days).

OAuth provider ID for BYOC (Bring Your Own Credentials) authentication.
Set to enable user-specific OAuth tokens for this publisher.

ownership_tracking_enabled.description: Enable resource ownership tracking (legacy gateway parity)

price_per_execution.description: Price per execution for agent templates or usage-based billing

protected_operations.description: Protected operations configuration - legacy, use endpoints[].is_protected instead

remove_asset_ids.description: Asset IDs to remove from accepted assets

request_content_type.description: Content-Type for upstream API requests (default: application/json)

requires_user_oauth.description:
If true, users must connect via OAuth before using this publisher (BYOC mode).
Requires oauth_provider_id to be set.

resource_id_url_pattern.description: URL pattern with :resourceId placeholder (for ownership tracking)

token_cache_ttl_seconds.description: TTL for cached exchanged tokens in seconds (60-86400)

token_exchange_method.description: HTTP method for exchange endpoint (POST or GET)

token_exchange_mode.description: How to send Seren token: header, body, or query

WalletRecoverRequest.description:
Request to recover an agent account using a recovery code.

Use this endpoint when you've lost access to your API key but have your
recovery code (provided when setting up wallet recovery or on first deposit).

recovery_code.description: Recovery code (24 characters). Dashes/whitespace are allowed; letters are case-insensitive.

new_recovery_code.description: New recovery code (the old one has been rotated). Save this securely!

paid_amount_usd.description: Original Stripe payment amount (only for fiat_purchase source)
